concept.title: Common Prerequities to Consider Before Using a Manual Typewriter
concept.shortdesc: Essential factors to evaluate before operating a manual typewriter.

ul.li: Typewriter – A fully functional manual typewriter with responsive keys and a properly aligned platen.
Paper – Standard printer paper is compatible with most models, though older typewriters may require thicker stock paper for adequate grip and print clarity.
Position the typewriter on a stable, flat surface to minimize vibration and ensure steady typing.
Ensure adequate lighting for clear visibility of keys and typed text.
Keep essential accessories, such as extra paper or ribbons, within easy reach.
Provide sufficient desk space to allow free movement of the carriage without obstruction.
Allow clearance behind the machine for paper to feed and exit smoothly.
Maintain an uncluttered surrounding area to support comfortable arm and hand movement.
Sit upright with your back supported and feet flat on the floor.
Align the typewriter at or slightly below elbow height to reduce wrist strain.
Relax shoulders and maintain neutral wrist alignment while typing to prevent fatigue.
